page.title: 07Buildings of Interest
page.content: HEMSWORTH HOUSE: the original was mentioned in the Domesday Book,called "Hemedfworde" THE OLD BAKEHOUSE: the last of three bakeries to operate in the village situated next to the alms houses on Pound Hill. CHAPEL: rebuilt in 1890 on site of the 1811 original, it has its own graveyard and stands on ridgetop of field behind the church; the field between the chapel and the church is called The Vineyard - a site of Ancient Roman interest. OLD POST OFFICE: thatched and situated west of Crichel Park gates, it became the first telephone excange in the district in 1870 and is now a private dwelling. VILLAGE SCHOOL: known to exist in 1846 APPLEGARTH: previously known as School House it houses the present Head.
